properties.areaDesc: Christian, KY; Graves, KY; Muhlenberg, KY; Trigg, KY; Todd, KY; Calloway, KY
properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 7 at 3:26PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
Although the rainfall amounts further north across the Quad State
region are trending lower with the latest forecasts, the southern
border counties of west Kentucky still remain in a zone where one
to one and a half inches of rain may occur late Wednesday night
into Thursday morning.

Given the timing and intensity of the rainfall, this may have the
potential for producing isolated flooding of low lying or poorly
drained locations.

There continues to remain significant uncertainty as to the
evolution of weather system expected to develop and move out of
California this weekend. The location, intensity, and movement of
this system will have a direct impact on rainfall amounts over
southern sections of west Kentucky Wednesday night and early
Thursday, especially along and south of a Mayfield to Greenville
Kentucky line.

Individuals and organizations in southern sections of west
Kentucky should continue to monitor forecasts through early next
week for any further assessment of heavy rain potential.

NWSheadline: Locally Heavy Rain still a possibility for the southern border counties of West Kentucky late Wednesday night into Thursday
